content: Well done, Geoff. Your old man should be proud of you, you absolutely nailed it. You, like my 20-year-old, drama-major son, "get it;" "it," being the meaning of military service and sacrifice. And while our generations can be light-years away from each other in many ways, you both "get it" because of the example of your veteran fathers. I'm sure you're glad your father is still around, not only because of what he can share with you, but also what you able to share with him now that you are grown. I lost my Air Force veteran father when I was 23 years old. He never saw me in uniform, and he never met his grandson. I've always regretted that we didn't talk more -- of course, neither of us knew at the time that he would be gone and at St Michael's side at 56 years old. There is a song by Mike and the Mechanics, "In the Living Years," that says it all: "I wasn't there that morning when my father passed away. I didn't get to tell him all the things I had to say. "I thought I caught his spirit, later that same year. I'm sure I heard his echo in my baby's newborn tears. I just wish I could have told him in The Living Years." I couldn't have said it better myself. Here's the link to the song: In The Living Years years." In The Living Years

title: Thank a Soldier Op-Ed; Geoff Tate

content: another song that might relate in the sense that our fathers are a big part of each of us. "I'm Already There" - Lonestar He called her on the road From a lonely cold hotel room Just to hear her say I love you one more time But when he heard the sound Of the kids laughing in the background He had to wipe away a tear from his eye A little voice came on the phone Said daddy when you coming home He said the first thing that came to his mind Im already there Take a look around Im the sunshine in your hair Im the shadow on the ground Im the whisper in the wind Im your imaginary friend And I know Im in your prayers Oh Im already there She got back on the phone Said I really miss you darling Dont worry about the kids theyll be alright Wish I was in your arms Lying right there beside you But I know that Ill be in your dreams tonight And Ill gently kiss your lips Touch you with my fingertips So turn out the light and close your eyes Im already there Dont make a sound Im the beat in your heart Im the moonlight shining down Im the whisper in the wind And Ill be there until the end Can you feel the love that we share Oh Im already there We may be a thousand miles apart But Ill be with you wherever you are Im already there Take a look around Im the sunshine in your hair Im the shadow on the ground Im the whisper in the wind And Ill be there until the end Can you feel the love that we share Oh Im already there Oh Im already There

content: Excellent. "I'm Already There" also has an additional meaning to me. It came out after 9-11, and every time I hear it, I think about all the victims, military and civilian...
